commit_message:
Fix missing key error in libvirt.driver

The libvirt disk mapping refactor change introduced
a bug in libvirt.driver.get_guest_config where we were
attempting to perform instance_update using a non-existent
key in the disk_mapping.

Given that we already parsed out the root_device_name and stored
it in a variable, and then verify that it's set in an if
statement before this method we should be just using what
we've already parsed.

Fixes bug: 1118829

Change-Id: Ifd80e67740d6f257ee537b68e9afe028273484d2

commit_message:
Remove nova.db call from baremetal PXE driver

Baremetal PXE driver was fetching instance_type from the nova db.
Now that no-db-compute is done, that's not possible. Also, there's a
more efficient way -- just call extract_instance_type(instance)!

Baremetal unit tests should check for instance_types with swap = 0 and
with swap > 0. This required changing test/utils to include a
real copy of instance_types in instance['system_metadata'].

Change-Id: I2a91e5c026782946f6b01e4189ec85d30ba87583

commit_message:
Mark password config options with secret

Config object supports masking values when writing out if the secret
flag is set on the option definition.  This change flags all glance
options containing a password.

Change-Id: Id8428fbd5c0090840c8e9adf86badb794cf9fd66

two requests for an inline doc and an exception change, and one possible error in virsh parsing.

Also, I think there is an issue with the handling around _check_for_node -- it looks like activate_node, reboot_node, etc, will still return ACTIVE, even if the specified node doesn't exist and nothing was run.

The current handling in ipmi.py is to return baremetal_states.ERROR if the call fails for any reason (but never throw an exception, aside from during init). I think this is reasonable for now, and should be reproduced here."}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2012-12-29 01:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2012-12-29 02:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2013-01-03 21:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-01-03 21:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (5 inline comments)

  * delete
  * reboot

New files for baremetal driver:
  * nova/virt/baremetal/vbox.py
  * nova/virt/baremetal/virsh.py

Activate by setting :
  * baremetal_power_manager=nova.virt.baremetal.vbox.VboxPowerManager
  * baremetal_power_manager=nova.virt.baremetal.virsh.VirshPowerManager

'}, {'created': '2013-01-03 21:06:42.000000000', 'message': "add basic power control for virtualbox and virsh

adds basic power control for VirtualBox and Virsh
  * boot
  * delete
  * reboot

New files for baremetal driver:
  * nova/virt/baremetal/virtual_power_driver.py
  * nova/virt/baremetal/virtual_power_driver_exceptions.py
  * nova/virt/baremetal/virtual_power_driver_settings.py

Activate by setting :
  * baremetal_power_manager=nova.virt.baremetal.virtual_power_driver.VirtualPowerManager
  * Config OptGroup name='baremetal' :virtual_power_type = 'VBox' for Virtual Box
  * Config OptGroup name='baremetal' :virtual_power_type = 'Virsh' for Virsh

Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I9935a9a30a166a9c28a9abb139c49f219a32ddd7

adds basic power control for VirtualBox and Virsh
  * boot
  * delete
  * reboot

New files for baremetal driver:
  * nova/virt/baremetal/virtual_power_driver.py
  * nova/virt/baremetal/virtual_power_driver_settings.py

Activate by setting :
  * baremetal_power_manager=nova.virt.baremetal.virtual_power_driver.VirtualPowerManager
  * Config OptGroup name='baremetal' :virtual_power_type = 'VBox' for Virtual Box
  * Config OptGroup name='baremetal' :virtual_power_type = 'Virsh' for Virsh
  * Config OptGroup name='baremetal' :virtual_power_ssh_host (vm host address)
  * Config OptGroup name='baremetal' :virtual_power_host_user (ssh user with rights to manage service)
  * Config OptGroup name='baremetal' :virtual_power_host_pass (ssh users password)

Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I9935a9a30a166a9c28a9abb139c49f219a32ddd7

"}, {'created': '2013-01-09 23:42:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add a virtual PowerDriver for Baremetal testing

This virtual_power_driver provides the ability for baremetal driver to
start/stop/reboot VMs within common dev/test environments. Its goal is to
approximate the same functionality as other PowerDrivers (eg. IPMI) within
a desktop development environments and within the devstack-gate environment.

Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I9935a9a30a166a9c28a9abb139c49f219a32ddd7

commit_message:
Add a virtual PowerDriver for Baremetal testing

This virtual_power_driver provides the ability for baremetal driver to
start/stop/reboot VMs within common dev/test environments. Its goal is to
approximate the same functionality as other PowerDrivers (eg. IPMI) within
a desktop development environments and within the devstack-gate environment.

Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I9935a9a30a166a9c28a9abb139c49f219a32ddd7

commit_message:
Update modules from common required for rpc with lock detection.

This change updates the versions of the local, lockutils and rpc
modules from common. This is required so that I can implement
automated detection of rpcs being made while holding locks, which
will come in a later review.

Sneaks up on bug 1063222.

Change-Id: I3689c133d1efc7425a44662abbdb434b5f36c64e

commit_message:
Extension for rebuild-for-ha

Adds an extension for blueprint rebuild-for-ha

Evacuation of VM from a failed host for HA.
New api supports recreate/rebuild modes. With shared storage,
VM is recreated on the target from disk.
Otherwise, rebuild from original image is performed.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id7e3e68dbaaf74e9314440d98195a92454078fd9
Co-authored-by: Oshrit Feder <oshritf@il.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Allow ability to remove security groups from ports

This commit adds the option --no-security-groups to port-update
in order to remove security groups from a port.

Fixes bug 1112089

Change-Id: I43a5cc2c8b443f2d34fffe66b442925a5ae312ac

commit_message:
Add to multi-tenant swift store documentation

Make the usage of the 'swift_store_admin_tenants' parameter
a little clearer.

Fixes bug 1110597.

Change-Id: Ibcfe5d74b89e35ac65d442ebfa6f75b0f8519af4

commit_message:
HACK - DO NOT MERGE.

This is test-only hack to help catch remaining database accesses from
the nova-compute service.

Related to bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I328fa92d5bfdadd5022f5c7efe981396d8ae7962

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-07 21:55:19.000000000', 'message': "Relational API links

- Adds a self-relational link to both individual API entities and
  collections.
- Adds null previous/next links to collections to support pagination in
  the future.
- Temporarily disables pagination (fixes bug 1079661), as the client
  doesn't currently support or expect it. We probably need to return all
  results by default unless the client requests a limited resultset
  anyway.
- Expands test coverage for granting roles to users & groups in projects
  & domains.

Change-Id: Ib5d6d39f5e1eb673c3285ef0b98603c5d375de75
"}, {'created': '2013-02-07 21:56:51.000000000', 'message': "Relational API links

- Adds a self-relational link to both individual API entities and
  collections.
- Adds null previous/next links to collections to support pagination in
  the future.
- Temporarily disables pagination (fixes bug 1079661), as the client
  doesn't currently support or expect it. We probably need to return all
  results by default unless the client requests a limited resultset
  anyway.
- Expands test coverage for granting roles to users & groups in projects
  & domains.

Change-Id: Ib5d6d39f5e1eb673c3285ef0b98603c5d375de75
"}]
commit_message:
Relational API links

- Adds a self-relational link to both individual API entities and
  collections.
- Adds null previous/next links to collections to support pagination in
  the future.
- Temporarily disables pagination (fixes bug 1079661), as the client
  doesn't currently support or expect it. We probably need to return all
  results by default unless the client requests a limited resultset
  anyway.
- Expands test coverage for granting roles to users & groups in projects
  & domains.

Change-Id: Ib5d6d39f5e1eb673c3285ef0b98603c5d375de75

commit_message:
Fixing sphinx docs.

Added the docs testenv back, which I hope won't break stackforge
CI. Updated the run_local.sh script since it was also broken.

Change-Id: I87245ab123b03aefb283eba184304312bd18c228
Fixes: bug #1119748

commit_message:
add non-routed subnet metadata support

implements blueprint metadata-non-routed

This patchset completes Quantum metadata support by adding metadata
proxy support for isolated network segments.  The support requires that
the guest instance request host routes, so that the DHCP port can be
used to proxy metadata requests. NOTE: The cirros image does not support
host router, so the UEC or equivalent required for testing and usage.

Change-Id: I962deef7c164ecb2a93b7af326ef8dca6e2b183a

commit_message:
Store all account info in memcache.

- Fixes bug 1119282.
- Allowing middleware accessing the metadata of an account without
  having to store it separately in a new memcache namespace.

Change-Id: Ib6bbb0c0dcebd770086ba7ad4c69ae9faf9d3e08

(after discussion with Anne Gentle) with Pep 008 correction

'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-12-11 14:46:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Bump. Looking for reviews on this patch. I'm now comfortable with it myself, now that it includes the necessary tests."}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2012-12-11 15:00:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It would be great, as part of the move to oslo, to update this  code to support connections to multiple databases.

In Moniker - We have both our our database, and potentially a second for things like connections to the PowerDNS DB.

Our approach involved turning `_MAKER` and `_ENGINE` into dict's called `_MAKERS` and `_ENGINES` - finally `get_engine` and `get_session` were updated to take a "key" as the first argument, allowing us to ask for a "moniker" and a "powerdns" session.

These changes (among some others) are included here[1] for reference.

[1]: https://github.com/stackforge/moniker/commit/f8df098d3059d6a9c58395348eb876394d825fe4'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-12-11 15:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-12-11 15:47:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

Kiall Mac Innes: My intention is to bring in the stable code that is exists in one of the project repositories with minimal changes and minimal impact to integrate with the various consuming projects. I do know the baremetal nova group is making, or had made, similar changes as well... so I agree your changes are necessary, I'll check on the status of the baremetal code and will review yours as well."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-12-11 16:12:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Kiall Mac Innes: It seems that while not tightly integrated, what you want is technically possible. See nova/nova/virt/baremetal/db/sqlalchemy/session.py, where they use the code I'm submitting here to use a second database from a single project.

I'm not opposed to your approach, but I'd personally like your additions merged into Nova or Glance first, since your file is otherwise divergent than can be integrated directly (such as missing the config options)

Are you okay with merging this how it is, and potentially making your suggested improvement later?"}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2012-12-11 16:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Yes - Happy to see it merge..

And - Yea - Our SQLA code has changed somewhat, and started life as the already changed ceilometer SQLA code..

The commit link was simply to show the changes needed to support multiple connections, rather than being something that could be pulled wholesale.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-12-11 16:44:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

ping'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-23 06:41:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Hi,
Sorry for chiming in a little late. It is great that this is moving into common. From Quantum's side there are a few issues that trouble me:
1. In Quantum the database entries are stored under a DATABASE section in the configuration file. Using this patch will cause upgrade problems. In Quantum the configuration variables are not defined as part of the db api code. They are passed as a paremeter. Please see https://github.com/openstack/quantum/blob/master/quantum/db/api.py#L72.
2. At the moment Quantum database do not have the following: created_at, updated_at and deleted_at. This will require a database upgrade. Do we need this to be part of the common code? 
It is not clear what the upgrade process should be if someone decides to make use of this common code. The configuration variables are a concern at the moment.
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-23 06:41:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-23 09:39:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-02 14:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Gary, the columns created_at, updated_at and deleted_at are part of ModelBase. None of the code in common actually uses that class at present, it is only copied into common because it can be and are in use by Nova and Glance. Quantum could continue to use QuantumBase to no ill effect. However, I do question if the more basic version in Quantum might be of use in common, too...

The difference in accepting a parameter to configure_db versus using the global CONF is interesting and to be honest, I greatly prefer a non-global approach.  Looking now, my code is based on that of Glance and that code has been entirely rewritten (and /more/ globalized) since I submitted this patch for review.

The configure_db method will need to be either updated or replaced...'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-06 05:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: No score

Hi,
In Quantum we need to make a change regarding the database. I will move the configuration variables into the db code - this may at least solve this issue.
I have removed the -1. Can you please address the comment about the nova trace.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-06 05:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-06 05:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Sorry, there is still one outstanding issue - in Quantum the configuration file database entries are under the section DATABASE.
It would be great if we could continue to use this moving forward. It will ensure that the upgrade path is not broken.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-06 06:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Hi,
Sorry for the piece meal with information. In Quantum each plugin may have a different database model.
This is something that is passed to the database. Can you please look at: https://github.com/openstack/quantum/blob/master/quantum/db/api.py#L78
More specifically line https://github.com/openstack/quantum/blob/master/quantum/db/api.py#L121
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-06 07:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

One last item - I have done some refactoring on Quantum to enable us to at least same the same application facing API:
https://review.openstack.org/19049'}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2013-01-06 12:32:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-07 16:27:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Do not merge

My bad for taking so long to get around to review this

A bunch of major work has happened on this code in Nova since you copied it from there. I think we need to re-sync with Nova before proceeding

I've left some comments inline too about Oslo integration - avoid using oslo's exception module, how we should deal with sql_connection/sqlite_db defaults, etc.

I think we should make the immediate goal of this patch just to move this code from Nova into Oslo - to that end, before merging it, I'd like to also see a WIP patch removing it from Nova. We've done that for some other patches lately and it's really useful.

Once it's merged, we can start figuring out how to make it meet the requirements of other projects and clean up its API but if we copy it into Oslo and never remove the copy from Nova then we're going to be in a pretty bad mess. This is what happened with the service infrastructure code, so I want to avoid it."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-07 16:36:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Thanks Mark. I'll look through your comments and upload the Nova patch (which I have sitting locally already)"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-01-07 20:37:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

LGTM but in nova there are some new things"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-01-07 20:44:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-01-07 21:00:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Also there is a big problem. I am trying to change ModelBase.deleted() type from boolaen -> type(Model.id). 

So in query.soft_delete() method we should make something like:
        return self.update({'deleted': literal_column('id'),
                            'updated_at': literal_column('updated_at'),
                            'deleted_at': timeutils.utcnow()},
                           synchronize_session=synchronize_session)

and in model.soft_delete() method:
self.deleted = self.id

There was a lot of work with nova db.api. So I'm not sure that it will be easy to apply this to other projects, but I think that common code should be like in nova."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-07 21:09:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

I've actually thought to put the model.py as a separate change since nothing else in this patch depends on it? Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-01-07 21:16:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Yes, it can be put as separated patches. But I don't understand why do you want to make it in separated patches? I think that there is no reason.."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-07 21:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Mostly because the models seem to diverge more than the other pieces and has an impact on the database schema.'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-01-07 21:59:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

I have been developing only nova, so I don't know situation in other projects.
But I think that we should require that other projects follows this model. It will allow using unique constraints, also If you look at the inline comments then you will see that query.soft_delete() also wouldn't work correctly and it is allocated in session...

So I would prefer that you don't separate this patch."}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2013-01-09 09:28:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Regarding the issue of Soft-Delete .. I had left a comment on PS #11, but I'm pretty sure it went unnoticed :)

I'll repeat it here just in case!

I would really prefer if these columns [the deleted/deleted_at cols..] were not included in the nova -> oslo sync.

Nova/Glance may use these, but other projects (e.g. Quantim, Moniker) do not.

Maybe we can split the Base into two parts?

Something like this: http://paste.openstack.org/show/28907/"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:59:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Kiall Mac Innes, sorry I didn't saw you're comment =(

Yes I agree that splitting Base in two parts is great idea. (but as I say before I will prefer that it will be in this patch)

Could you please take a look at my inline comments. What do you think about session.py? In nova session is used own Query insted of sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query. And it has method soft_deleted which can be used only when all models have id and deleted columns.. So It is not good that such things are common..."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-17 20:24:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-17 20:28:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Import sqlalchemy session/models/utils

Bring in session, base model, utilities, and tests for sqlalchemy
from Nova.

Add sqlalchemy to pip-requires and and python-mysql to test-requires.

Partially implements blueprint common-db

Change-Id: I3e0065cdac87e10c4e0742d66c293c72bb3acbb2

commit_message:
UserApi.update not to require all fields in arg

LDAP backend's UserApi.update required caller to provide all User fields
in an argument while only changed ones are provided there.

Change-Id: Ia8f43efab7580483b9aa5de90f0a66ae544e230f

subject: Leverage style & eliminate msg unpacking.
messages:
[{'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-01-28 19:34:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (6 inline comments)

Don't fully understand it, but it seems like cleaner way, so I'm for it."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-28 19:57:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

A big part of the intention here is such that the message doesn't have to be deserialized and reserialized by ZmqProxy. This will allow signed messages to be verified by the final recipient, once message signing is enabled. Additionally, I intend to follow up with a patch that will use references, not copies, of ZeroMQ frames as a memory optimization (right now, messages are copied from ZeroMQ into Python, then copied back into ZeroMQ where we could just pass around a reference)"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-02-08 19:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Split into multiple more coherent patches.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-28 17:40:45.000000000', 'message': 'Leverage style & eliminate msg unpacking.

The style field has been used and reserved.
This patch passes the message type
over the style field and uses this to
optimize message processing.

The message unpacking on the proxy
has proven to be unnecessary. This is
a fairly slow operation, so we should
avoid doing it.

Additionally, packing and unpacking
the message has security implications
once we move to trusted messaging.

Also removes the passing of msg_id by
non-call/reply messages as it was
redundant and not necessary for
backwards compatiblity.

Change-Id: Idbc9291fcce6ff6f6108573811d065a5c2c24255

Fixes to msg unpacking and style

Change-Id: I9d6a1483afaed59462e208102448acccc02cff63
'}]
commit_message:
Leverage style & eliminate msg unpacking.

The style field has been used and reserved.
This patch passes the message type
over the style field and uses this to
optimize message processing.

The message unpacking on the proxy
has proven to be unnecessary. This is
a fairly slow operation, so we should
avoid doing it.

Additionally, packing and unpacking
the message has security implications
once we move to trusted messaging.

Also removes the passing of msg_id by
non-call/reply messages as it was
redundant and not necessary for
backwards compatiblity.

Change-Id: Idbc9291fcce6ff6f6108573811d065a5c2c24255

Fixes to msg unpacking and style

Change-Id: I9d6a1483afaed59462e208102448acccc02cff63

commit_message:
Deprecate is_admin feature.

- This has been confusing since the beginning of keystoneauth.
- Do not remove the feature but just print a large warning when
  used.

Change-Id: I13990d7ab6760bb6479cf4f0717067522e1ef920

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-07 19:22:14.000000000', 'message': 'Change the flag set to specify bulk delete and expand archives from a HTTP
header to a query parameter.

This is needed because query parameters show up in proxy logs and headers do
not. With this change it will be easy to determine from any log line that gets
created from the original request (of which there is currently none) that the
request was a bulk action.

Note: This is not backwards compatible with the previous method of setting a
header. Because the bulk middleware has not been included in an openstack swift
release this should be fine.

Change-Id: I0297fa2de9e491bf0b8c430c0781e2e12316ed4b
'}]
commit_message:
Change the flag set to specify bulk delete and expand archives from a HTTP
header to a query parameter.

This is needed because query parameters show up in proxy logs and headers do
not. With this change it will be easy to determine from any log line that gets
created from the original request (of which there is currently none) that the
request was a bulk action.

Note: This is not backwards compatible with the previous method of setting a
header. Because the bulk middleware has not been included in an openstack swift
release this should be fine.

Change-Id: I0297fa2de9e491bf0b8c430c0781e2e12316ed4b

The fact that we have to mock ceilometer.pipeline.setup_pipeline in so many of the tests is a little disconcerting.'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2013-02-08 01:27:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Doug, the reason is currently if there is no pipeline configuration file, the setup_pipeline will cause exception. That's the reason that originally I didn't raise exception if no pipeline configuration file in pipeline.py 

Another choice is to place a pipeline file in the tests directory, which we discussed before and you think not so good either.

Any other suggestion? Should we have the agent manager to handle the exception? I'm glad to cook a patch to change it if we have solid idea for it.

--jyh"}, {'account_id': 4491, 'date': '2013-02-08 01:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

How about the following 2 options:

1. stub out the result of pipeline configuration file reading with a pre-defined dict value for test.

2. create an temporary pipeline configuration file and use that for CONF.pipeline_cfg_file'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-02-08 16:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

I think the problem is that the AgentManager is instantiating the pipeline manager, instead of taking a pipeline manager as an argument as it does with the extension manager. If the code that created the AgentManager instance created the pipeline manager, we could provide a mock or subclass in a test base class, instead of having to copy the patch call to every test that uses an AgentManager.'}]

commit_message:
Update meter publish with pipeline framework

With multiple publisher support, change meter publish
to utilize this framework.

for bp multi-publisher
Change-Id: I6c2cba15ebadd3dabfb99296fab060cae23d3cf7
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Exchanges should return directed topics.

Exchanges in the matchmaker are supposed
to return a directed topic as the first
element in returned tuples.

Adds a test to ensure this is so.

Change-Id: I6c62f325914faa19216d5362c6d8ed0288942110

Can we default to not including the option on the dnsmasq command line if a valid value is not set?  I don't like the idea of defaulting to sending packets to an outside DNS server that some organizations explicitly block. commit_message:
Add dhcp server option to dnsmasq for baremetal

This sets the dns option for baremetal deploy clients.
this is useful for clients who may require external access
during the deployment process.

Change-Id: Ibe680d2acaad826e4868223ebfd1f112d7796662
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Avoid vm instance shutdown when power state is NOSTATE

Occasionally when nova uses libvirt lib to query hypervisor
xen the instance state of vm_power_state may end up
with a NOSTATE value. Existing code shuts down the instance
when we hit this state. Remove the check for NOSTATE
to avoid shutting down the instance.

Fixes LP #1085771.

Change-Id: I0025f6800b6ca9cd3d7c7e6119b9a819571bd13c

[{'created': '2013-02-08 05:44:47.000000000', 'message': "Add generic nose/testtools attr decorator

Adds support for a tempest specific attr decorator which calls
the nose.plugsin.attrib attr decorator as well as the
testtools.testcase attr decorator if it is type='smoke'.

This will allow us to more smoothly transition to testtools attr
support without losing any nose functionality and preserve use of
attributes such as positive/negative/whitebox etc indefinitely.

Change-Id: Ib1ca7b5ed313b7dda55e68357f21186368df0ce6
"}]
commit_message:
Add generic nose/testtools attr decorator

Adds support for a tempest specific attr decorator which calls
the nose.plugsin.attrib attr decorator as well as the
testtools.testcase attr decorator if it is type='smoke'.

This will allow us to more smoothly transition to testtools attr
support without losing any nose functionality and preserve use of
attributes such as positive/negative/whitebox etc indefinitely.

Change-Id: Ib1ca7b5ed313b7dda55e68357f21186368df0ce6

subject: Allow initset to configure multi string options
messages:
[{'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-07 02:50:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

This was initially in this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21279/ and then split following Sean's advice."}, {'account_id': 5280, 'date': '2013-02-07 05:25:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-02-07 06:14:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I'm not particularly fond of this change.  If it must be done, I'd rather factor out an iniadd() function.  But then we're on the hook to document or fix all of the other ini functions in regard to their behaviour with multi-valued options. Plus appropriate tests."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-07 09:12:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Dean,

I had the same thought but as the new function would share most of the logic of iniset, then I thought it migth be worth updating it.

I understand your concern and I'm not going to keep pushing it.
I don't understand if you're happy with a iniadd, or if you want this bug to be marked as invalid and find other solutions for code which needs to set a value multiple times."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-07 09:14:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-07 11:15:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/21402/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/1357 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21402/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/1082 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21402/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/5351 : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-02-07 15:54:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Adding multi-value option support requires more than just iniadd() and I am not going to let a half-way implementation get in.  I don't like it because it complicates the other functions and changes the assumptions about how they work.

I'm thinking of bending the ear of whomever thought adding multi-value options to OpenStack cfg was a good idea. ;)  INI files are not data structure containers."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-07 17:06:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Dean,

as much as I can agree with you that multi string and list options are at least redundant, We have one of those options in the nicira quantum plugin. Since I think here and there these options are used, I initially thought that it might be good to do a change in devstack's infrastructure instead of a hack in the nicira quantum plugin's configuration code.

On the other side, I'm really not willing to write full support for handling multi string options in ini files. Treating them as arrays is going to be far from easy, and is definitely error prone.

So if nobody shows up in 24 hours and says they'd support multi string options too, I'll abandon this patch, mark the bug as invalid, and push a different solution for the quantum nicira plugin."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-08 12:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

abandoning as agreed.'}]

commit_message:
L3 API support for nicira plugin

blueprint nvp-l3-api

This patch adds supports the Quantum L3 API extension to the nicira NVP
Quantum Plugin.

The patch includes code for managing Quantum routers, router interfaces,
external gateways, and floating IPs, and for applying the relevant
configurations on the NVP controller using the NVP API.

The patch also includes NVP-specific support for access to the nova
metadata server via injection of a host route in VM instances.

Change-Id: Ib00f45e37a56ddbd2762866c12cfc4cd09f7367f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-07 21:06:29.000000000', 'message': "Simplify MySQL/eventlet threaded db pooling.

Simplify the MySQL-only threaded DB pooling.  Use SQLAlchemy's standard
QueuePool, but source connections via a custom creator function.  The
creator proxies requests to get connections from MySQL through
eventlet's thread pool singleton. (tpool)

This is simpler than having both a SQLAlchemy and eventlet
TpooledConnectionPool where each connection pool had different
settings to keep in sync.

Also, pass the 'pool_size' and 'max_overflow' settings to SQLAlchemy.
They were previously missing.

Change-Id: I481424bb03b2da248757fa1c1af9db6be5f5d794
"}, {'created': '2013-02-07 21:10:17.000000000', 'message': "Simplify MySQL/eventlet threaded db pooling.

creator proxies requests to get connections from MySQL through
eventlet's thread pool singleton. (tpool)

This is simpler than having both a SQLAlchemy and eventlet
TpooledConnectionPool where each connection pool had different
settings to keep in sync.

Also, pass the 'pool_size' and 'max_overflow' settings to SQLAlchemy.
They were previously missing.

Change-Id: I481424bb03b2da248757fa1c1af9db6be5f5d794
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify MySQL/eventlet threaded db pooling.

Simplify the MySQL-only threaded DB pooling.  Use SQLAlchemy's standard
QueuePool, but source connections via a custom creator function.  The
creator proxies requests to get connections from MySQL through
eventlet's thread pool singleton. (tpool)

This is simpler than having both a SQLAlchemy and eventlet
TpooledConnectionPool where each connection pool had different
settings to keep in sync.

Also, pass the 'pool_size' and 'max_overflow' settings to SQLAlchemy.
They were previously missing.

Change-Id: I481424bb03b2da248757fa1c1af9db6be5f5d794

I am still mightily confused. The _set_auth in the subclass will send an auth request to keystone with 2.0 in it. Then other requests will use 3.0. Is that what is desired? I am not going to -1 this but would like Jay's opinion."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-07 22:45:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-02-08 04:53:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Do not merge

Hi Harika,

OK, so the biggest problem with this patch is that it modifies the base RestClient unnecessarily.

If we want to start testing Keystone V3 API, then the correct way to do that is to set the [identity] config section's uri to end with /v3 instead of /v2.0.

You should be able to just create a PolicyClient based from tempest.common.rest_client.RestClient.

In the PolicyClient class' __init__() method, you should make a call using the underlying client object to check whether the /policies resource endpoint is even available on the Keystone server, and if not, then set an attribute is_enabled on the class to False. Then, in your test_policy.py test class, just check whether the policies client is enabled and if not, skip the test.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 6455, 'date': '2013-02-08 08:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-02-08 08:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Test cases for Policy V3 API

Adds a test script "test_policy.py" so as to test all the policy
API actions. Implementation done in JSON and XML interfaces.

Change-Id: Id2875ab6212c273316829caf602e57767940c58b
Implements: blueprint keystone-v3-policy-api-test

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-07 08:18:44.000000000', 'message': 'Convert to use testtools attr implementation 3/3

Convert from nose @attr decorator implementation to testtools
implementation for smoke tests. This works by mangling the test
id to append the attr value. Eg

tempest.tests.identity.admin.test_users.UsersTestXML.test_create_user

looks like:

tempest.tests.identity.admin.test_users.UsersTestXML.test_create_user[smoke]

The CI tests are no longer restricted to only running the smoke
tests, but under testr it will be possible to run only the smoke
tests by running:

testr run smoke

With nosetests it will I think be necessary to list the tests
first, filter and then feed it back to nosetests.

If we want to preserve the ability to just run smoke tests easily
in the future we should avoid using the word smoke in any of the
test names.

Attributes like positive and negative have been removed as they
were inconsistently applied to tests anyway. There are some other
attributes such as whitebox or image which have also been removed
which can just as easily be selected by test name.

Patch is broken into 3 parts to make it a bit easier to review

Change-Id: Ie9dfab727944cb1f9f0059cb162b56ce9b308003
'}, {'created': '2013-02-07 08:19:44.000000000', 'message': 'Convert to use testtools attr implementation 3/3

Convert from nose @attr decorator implementation to testtools
implementation for smoke tests. This works by mangling the test
id to append the attr value. Eg

tempest.tests.identity.admin.test_users.UsersTestXML.test_create_user

looks like:

tempest.tests.identity.admin.test_users.UsersTestXML.test_create_user[smoke]

The CI tests are no longer restricted to only running the smoke
tests, but under testr it will be possible to run only the smoke
tests by running:

testr run smoke

With nosetests it will I think be necessary to list the tests
first, filter and then feed it back to nosetests.

If we want to preserve the ability to just run smoke tests easily
in the future we should avoid using the word smoke in any of the
test names.

Attributes like positive and negative have been removed as they
were inconsistently applied to tests anyway. There are some other
attributes such as whitebox or image which have also been removed
which can just as easily be selected by test name.

Patch is broken into 3 parts to make it a bit easier to review

Blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: Ie9dfab727944cb1f9f0059cb162b56ce9b308003
'}]
commit_message:
Convert to use testtools attr implementation 3/3

Convert from nose @attr decorator implementation to testtools
implementation for smoke tests. This works by mangling the test
id to append the attr value. Eg

tempest.tests.identity.admin.test_users.UsersTestXML.test_create_user

looks like:

tempest.tests.identity.admin.test_users.UsersTestXML.test_create_user[smoke]

The CI tests are no longer restricted to only running the smoke
tests, but under testr it will be possible to run only the smoke
tests by running:

testr run smoke

With nosetests it will I think be necessary to list the tests
first, filter and then feed it back to nosetests.

If we want to preserve the ability to just run smoke tests easily
in the future we should avoid using the word smoke in any of the
test names.

Attributes like positive and negative have been removed as they
were inconsistently applied to tests anyway. There are some other
attributes such as whitebox or image which have also been removed
which can just as easily be selected by test name.

Patch is broken into 3 parts to make it a bit easier to review

Blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: Ie9dfab727944cb1f9f0059cb162b56ce9b308003

commit_message:
Convert to use testtools attr implementation 2/3

Convert from nose @attr decorator implementation to testtools
implementation for smoke tests. This works by mangling the test
id to append the attr value. Eg

tempest.tests.identity.admin.test_users.UsersTestXML.test_create_user

looks like:

tempest.tests.identity.admin.test_users.UsersTestXML.test_create_user[smoke]

The CI tests are no longer restricted to only running the smoke
tests, but under testr it will be possible to run only the smoke
tests by running:

testr run smoke

With nosetests it will I think be necessary to list the tests
first, filter and then feed it back to nosetests.

If we want to preserve the ability to just run smoke tests easily
in the future we should avoid using the word smoke in any of the
test names.

Attributes like positive and negative have been removed as they
were inconsistently applied to tests anyway. There are some other
attributes such as whitebox or image which have also been removed
which can just as easily be selected by test name.

Patch is broken into 3 parts to make it a bit easier to review

Blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: I511c32b3b02a63a1ec15ef3acc039b873a9a70bc

test_get_default_quotas currently uses assertSequenceEqual to compare
quota sets which causes equal, but differently ordered, sets to fail.
This change switches to assertEquals to allow those sets to succeed.

Change-Id: Ib11bc915673404b852e77a72222d388dba8a4ead
Fixes: bug #1118754
'}]
commit_message:
Change test_get_default_quotas to use assertEqual

test_get_default_quotas currently uses assertSequenceEqual to compare
quota sets which causes equal, but differently ordered, sets to fail.
This change switches to assertEquals to allow those sets to succeed.

Change-Id: Ib11bc915673404b852e77a72222d388dba8a4ead
Fixes: bug #1118754

With lots of files getting added in new tests I'd like to clarify the copyright issue but I think at the very least the year needs to be updated."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-03 10:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-03 10:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Probably I could implement a better tearDown.
But now I follow the "work as the other similar cases" solution.

I do not want to introduce a new style for teardown by this change.

I would like to see similar teardowns in the code before introducing a new more general one _in a different change_.

A basic little better would be:

NotFound -> log warn.
other -> log exception.

If any exception logged -> raise a teardown exception.


An even better solution, would consider a volume cannot be deleted when it has a snapshot, but would try to teardown them in parallel.

An even better would know, it does not have to wait.., the test cases initializiot has to wait, until we have enough free space or quota.

A better solution would be handle all resource and all of their dependencies, in an upper level.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-03 12:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2013-02-08 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

The idea is to easily extend and already created image with new elements. This image can have some specific packages versions that are no longer available on the repositories, or had being customized by hand, so recreating it from scratch is non an option.

Also, if you have a base image preloaded with some elements, is faster to test new elements but just adding them.'}, {'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2013-02-08 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-02-08 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Use an already created image as base for new ones.

We can create a base image with the elements needed, and increment it later.
This way, all new elements share the same base and the creation time is decreased.

Change-Id: I62b3ed8d5d13a2e68935a281c918b5d1ef51dbf5

I still do not agree with this.  I don't think the scheduler is the right place for this.  The scheduler is likely to become a service that we only use to ask questions... not to use as a proxy.  I think that it would be better to use nova-conductor for this....  Ie, have nova-conductor do the orchestration, doing rpc.calls to the scheduler to figure out where to move instances if needed."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-27 08:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Blocking this at least until others chime in.  I feel strongly enough that this is not the right way to go.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-01-30 23:48:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Yeah, I agree with Chris. I think if we're going to go through another service, nova-conductor is most appropriate.

Also, regardless of where it goes, this patch doesn't appear to make any functional changes other than adding an extra rpc hop.  So, I definitely wouldn't want this to go in unless there was other code ready to go right behind it that made the extra hop worth the cost."}, {'account_id': 3094, 'date': '2013-01-31 10:42:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-31 11:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/19636/4/check/gate-nova-docs/13729 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19636/4/check/gate-nova-pep8/19035 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19636/4/check/gate-nova-python26/15180 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19636/4/check/gate-nova-python27/15237 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19636/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/29242 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19636/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/3939 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19636/4/check/gate-nova-pylint/7323 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-01-31 11:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I would start this task from the other direction... I don't think this change is really needed.

Personally I think we need to look at merging the server operations of live-migrate and migrate.

Today live-migrate requires you to specify a host, but migrate doesn't let you specify a host, it asks the scheduler what is the best node to move the VM (but it should probably allow the usual scheduler hints you get for boot). A single call that allows you to specify live or non-live and block or non-block seems sensible.

You could then have host API call that is equivalent to:
- disable host (i.e. no more VMs get scheduled there)
- live migrate all VMs on that host, to another host, and if not possible maybe do a non-live migrate

Personally, it is probably better giving the administrator the tools to make this easy, and look at a combined operation later. I am a bit worried about trying to guess what the administrator would want to do for the edge/error cases.

The one tool that might be useful is a "try batch migrate" so you can tell, in a small cloud, if you have the capacity to be able to move all the VMs. But this is always going to be flawed when users start up other VMs in the background and mess up the calculations, unless you lease an allocation after the call, but that seems overkill!'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-01-31 17:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Do not merge

So it sounds like consensus on this is to start by moving things into the conductor. One good first step would combining the live-migrate / resize logic and and have conductor manage them. The conductor will eventually have to be involved for live-migrate anyway, since it is the only way we can ever hope to do it securely (i.e. not giving every hypervisor access to every other hypervisor)'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-08 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-08 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Change Set_host_maintenance to scheduler enabled

Set_host_maintenance in its current implementation
is based on specific driver capability (e.g. xenapi VM.pool_migrate).

A generic implementation that will enable this feature for other hypervisors
is based on nova-scheduler ability to schedule migrations of the VMs to other
compute nodes.

This implements blueprint host-maintenance

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1853bb8d3af699cc7f41d2b41919697e1e7c3c4d

Enabled when USE_CACHE==1. The $CACHE_DIR will be mounted as /.cache while building the images.

Some data is mostly static (github repos, pip downloads, templates) and frequently used. Putting them in the CACHE_DIR make it easy and quick to be used by the elemtents.

Change-Id: I154606aa946a3d2d98e1fd7b9d6bb1359e460af3
'}]
commit_message:
Mount a cache dir when building the images.

Enabled when USE_CACHE==1. The $CACHE_DIR will be mounted as /.cache while building the images.

Some data is mostly static (github repos, pip downloads, templates) and frequently used. Putting them in the CACHE_DIR make it easy and quick to be used by the elemtents.

Change-Id: I154606aa946a3d2d98e1fd7b9d6bb1359e460af3

commit_message:
Remove custom init/disabled code.

Since we can just run self.skipTest(msg) in a setUp method, there is no
real benefit to all of the crazy complexity laced throughout the tests
of dealing with disable/initted.

self.inited was there to prevent the cost of running init code more than once.
For now, with an aim on parallel test running, doing things fully correctly
is safer. If the net result isn't fast enough, we can define those global init
steps in terms of fixtures and then manage them with testresources.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Ic34f8be3ef2e200f3314b4ddea9849c42c8292bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-08 00:49:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for testrepository

Adds the testrepository config file needed to use testr to run the
tempest tests. To run the tests just do:

testr run

or to run them in parallel:

testr run --parallel

At this stage you may encounter one or two failures with --parallel due to
conflicts between a couple of tests that not have yet been fixed, but a serial
run should work fine.

Change-Id: I08121fdcd48e2f4ff86bf9e1d4d378f818699d89
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for testrepository

Adds the testrepository config file needed to use testr to run the
tempest tests. To run the tests just do:

testr run

or to run them in parallel:

testr run --parallel

At this stage you may encounter one or two failures with --parallel due to
conflicts between a couple of tests that not have yet been fixed, but a serial
run should work fine.

Change-Id: I08121fdcd48e2f4ff86bf9e1d4d378f818699d89

commit_message:
Allow to_primitive to ignore datetimes

In preparation for having nova.db.api not return any sqlalchemy objects.
nova.db.api will return only primitives, except for datetime.datetime
objects.

Uses functools.partial to make code DRYING

Partially implements bp db-api-cleanup

Change-Id: I9980d8c4e20b05bbe734cf90ac209e4e7e89befb

commit_message:
heat api : Add policy.json authorization to cloudwatch API

Adds a basic policy.json to authorize all actions for the CW API -
this will deny access to the in-instance users defined in stack
templates (which are assigned the heat_stack_user role) to all API
actions apart from PutMetricData action, which is used by
cfn-push-stats to provide metric data from the instances

Change-Id: I2bbb885bec98b85828cdb92d7efc0688da7be3c1
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

will prevent nova-network from having to resend the message
to actually allocate the fixed ips.

Part of blueprint optimize-nova-network

commands, but now it can be used at run-time to optimize a
call.

commit_message:
Optimize rpc handling for allocate and deallocate

If we are in multi_host mode we can save an extra rpc call by
sending the message to the instance host the first time. This
will prevent nova-network from having to resend the message
to actually allocate the fixed ips.

Part of blueprint optimize-nova-network

DocImpact: before multi_host only affected the network create
commands, but now it can be used at run-time to optimize the
path for allocating and deallocating fixed_ips, so it is important
to set it if you are using multi_host networks.

commit_message:
Move floating ip db access to calling side.

Most of the allocation for floating ips can be done on the calling
side, including finding the proper host to send the message to.
This saves us from making an rpc call for allocate/deallocate and
makes sure that we only need 1 call for associate/disassociate by
finding the proper host to send the message to immediately.

Getting exceptions to work properly required pulling in the helper
that was used by the conductor to regenerate exceptions that are
wrapped for rpc. Since this is now a shared class, it was moved
to utils.

Also a few config options were moved to avoid circular imports.

Part of blueprint optimize-nova-network

Change-Id: I6ec65b1f3e8d00cab778b10eec620760886567e0

commit_message:
Fixed apt-repo on host to be served on port 8090

Switched from port 8080 which is being used by swift-proxy
in the devstack-vm-gate scripts to port 8090. The guest
now connects to the host apt-repo on port 8090 to download
the my.cnf file.

Fixes bug: 1117080

Change-Id: I2efcf715b426a3e6d5caaf09729926714cb1a08d

commit_message:
Recache or rebuild missing images on hard_reboot

The primary purpose of this change is to provide the ability to
re-cache missing backing files on hard_reboot. The old
pre_block_migration function was already performing a very similar
operation. That function has been refactored to be idempotent and
renamed to _create_images_and_backing. The pre_block_migration
function is a wrapper, with some additional checking, around the
renamed function.

Image backend was also adjusted to look for either a missing backing
file or disk image, recaching or creating accordingly. It should
also be idempotent, never clobbering existing images.

Change-Id: Icf4c488d6db59e732b463d08d0606b428ee1e7b9

commit_message:
Quote image ids before passing them to glance

If the image id contains a space it needs to be quoted or else
it will construct an improper header.

Fixes bug 1111948

Change-Id: I4db2e74401b57de9666d40b38151182b2a76cd1b

'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-07 11:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-02-07 13:53:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Very cool.  But I would like to echo Dan Prince's question about this being in nova since nothing in here, except the directories, are specific to nova.  It seems generally useful for all projects.

But, seeing as this is concerned with regressions I would think it should be limited to reviews which are fixing bugs.  If I submit a patch that just adds tests coverage this would flag it as a failure.  On second thought, maybe it shouldn't be limited in when it runs, but maybe "SUCCESS" and "FAILURE" should be removed as outputs and just indicate whether or not it found a regression test.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-02-07 14:32:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think there is precedent for this, right? The unused imports checker script, for example. It seems like this would go in some CI-related tree to be easily run against lots of stuff, but I figured that their desire is to have it in tools/ like the others.'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-02-07 14:47:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

While there is precedence for CI related stuff in tools all the rest of those feel useful to me as a dev, while I find it unlikely I would run this locally.  But really I'm more curious about "why here" than bothered by it.

Maybe this it too nitpicky but the use of the word "FAILURE" is what keeps me from +1.  I don't think it's right to declare a patch a failure because it doesn't test regressions, since there are legitimate cases for not including regression tests in a patch.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-07 15:11:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I like the tool, but I'm off agreement that I don't think this belongs in nova. This should be in the CI infrastructure somewhere.

Unused imports doesn't quite count, because that's used in pep8 checking. But it doesn't require gerrit interaction, which seems like it should live outside the project."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-07 22:31:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

ok, after conversations on #infra, I'm ok with this going in short term to help with the release process, as something we'll extract later for more general use."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-07 22:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-07 22:34:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

as per conversation on openstack-infra, this will go into nova first and be pulled out later as part of a a larger effort spear headed by mordred.


Next patch will:
    * Change wording of output to not say FAILURE, and instead be say no regression test found.
    * If don't pass in gerrit_review_number, run regression_tester on current branch."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-07 23:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Add regression testing tool

Tool detects if a gerrit patch contains tests to detect a regression

Usage: ./tools/regression_tester.py gerrit_review_number

Change-Id: I6353d1efda73fe5fc3098f928b6da9a28eb40590

commit_message:
Add --keystone-user/group to keystone-manage pki_setup

If called as root, --keystone-user and --keystone-group can be
used to set the username and group keystone is going to run under.

In that case, pki_setup is going to issue additional os.chown
calls to change ownership of the PK files accordingly.

Fixes LP Bug #1031372

Change-Id: If9250ca9d0d86eebb9ad7c95ade17132ffd5a36c

commit_message:
Prevent Upstart from restarting guest in Restart tests

Stop the mysql service explicitly during the blackbox restart
tests, so that upstart does not try to re-spawn the mysql process
and cause test failures. This is needed for the blackbox tests to
successfully run.

Fixes bug: 1110895

Change-Id: I44cfeac3350913af5b6cb05b8b3373ab84c448f7

commit_message:
Fixed bug in domain_remap and cname_lookup middleware

If domain_remap and cname_lookup received request which has no host header,
then returns 500 error. This fixes that problem.

Change-Id: Ibb457e9b4cb21181d8243858c04ce255365690da
Fixes: bug #1100632

"}, {'created': '2013-02-07 04:01:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix lazy load 'system_metadata' failed problem.

When using lazy load of SQLAlchemy, parent instance may have
a problem not bouding to a session object and fail the lazy loading
system_metadata.
Using joinedload to eagly load the system_metadata in

Change-Id: Id24ca534f6eb57167aee22aca12c1274c90baf3c

commit_message:
Fix lazy load 'system_metadata' failed problem.

When using lazy load of SQLAlchemy, parent instance may have
a problem not bouding to a session object and fail the lazy loading
system_metadata.
Using joinedload to eagly load the system_metadata in
_instance_get_all_query to fix the problem.

Fixes: bug 1117232
Change-Id: Id24ca534f6eb57167aee22aca12c1274c90baf3c

If an id contains a space it needs to be quoted when making a
request to registry.

Fixes bug 1111948

commit_message:
Return to skipping filters when using force_hosts.

The folsom behavior was to skip filtering when using force_hosts.
This is useful for administrative tools. For example, one can verify
a disabled node by launching instances on it even though the scheduler
will ignore it for normal requests. This behavior was accidentally
changed in commit 0d9ce8319d75bfbd69fe4e0759aeed38e6054e56

Change-Id: Ib529cf8eccc4d8abe67873cfc0467f6db9d4b522

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20280/1/check/gate-nova-docs/12983 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/20280/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/6782 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-01-23 15:57:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

this changes the rpc api, so requires a version bump. The logic around the mac allocation seems like it could be dramatically simplified if the default was [] instead of None in both the dictionary get and the param.

Also, does it make sense to do the list manip like that, or just keep track of a counter and run the macs list, then catch the index out of bounds exception. Would reduce the gymnastics on that."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-01-23 22:30:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Sean - None means 'no constraint', which was the behaviour before mac constraints were added to the hypervisor driver. Making the default [], would mean 'by default do not permit any mac addresses at all', which is not what anyone is likely to want!"}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-01-23 23:01:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

This can be made quite a bit pithier and simpler without changing the None aspect - suggestions in comments. Also needs at least one more test for corner case handling.

I asked on IRC how to do the version bump:

11:55 < russellb> https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/rpc/dispatcher.py#L17
11:55 < russellb> bump RPC_API_VERSION in network/manager.py
11:56 < russellb> and in network/rpcapi.py, it needs version=<new version> added as an arg to self.cast() or 
                  self.call() (see other rpcapi.py files for examples)
11:56 < russellb> and rpcapi.py typically also has version history in a docstring
11:57 < russellb> manager side == version currently implemented ... rpcapi side == version required to be 
                  implemented to handle the message being sent"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-01-23 23:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@lifeless ok, agree on the None vs [], good catch on the need for the additional tests though.'}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2013-01-24 18:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2013-01-24 18:22:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

If you take the exception catch up one frame higher it will be better still - its what I meant, but wasn't clear on.

I don't think you need that fiddling with sys.exc_info - the last exception that reached the catching frame is the one reraised by a bare raise."}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2013-01-28 13:26:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Support hypervisor supplied macs in nova-network

When hypervisors supply a set of MAC addresses for instances, have
nova-network use the supplied values when creating VIFs.

This function is required for the PowerVM driver to be properly
supported.

Change-Id: I922797af6b2b829561f61095bef2098c2d31cde5

commit_message:
Fix incomplete sentence in help

`keystone help` only pulls a one line summary from docstrings, so this
summary needed to be condensed.

Change-Id: I9b08c6a8153101b1cc338955078d0d3b6a0aa02e

[{'created': '2013-02-07 16:30:45.000000000', 'message': "Re-add setuptools-git to setup.py.

In 81cbbcc4e01c81084c352f7fc1ecea149089a2b9 we removed:

  setup_requires=['setuptools-git>=0.4'],

from setup.py. This broke tarball generation in that some files are
now missing.

Fixes LP Bug #1118511.

Change-Id: I27a09e0d49befa3751031582d1b152677822041f
"}]
commit_message:
Re-add setuptools-git to setup.py.

In 81cbbcc4e01c81084c352f7fc1ecea149089a2b9 we removed:

  setup_requires=['setuptools-git>=0.4'],

from setup.py. This broke tarball generation in that some files are
now missing.

Fixes LP Bug #1118511.

Change-Id: I27a09e0d49befa3751031582d1b152677822041f

subject: Ban database access in nova-compute

messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-02-06 16:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-02-06 16:42:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We already declare that db access is not allowed in nova-compute at the service level. However, that's not going to do anything for the other pieces that import and use the db directly. Russell has had a HACK patch up for a while that traces out database accesses for a while now and I've been using it to measure progress. As of yesterday, I see no accesses traced out in a full tempest run.

I propose that we put something like this into the tree before G-3 so that we're actually hard-failing any situations we might have missed for the folks that test G-3 in real environments prior to the grizzly release. I don't think we're going to sniff anything else out any other way.

I expect just getting smokestack to run against this will expose a few more.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-06 16:44:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This looks like a good way to attack the problem to me. Worst case, we have to revert the patch before Grizzly final, and this patch is so simple that that won't be a problem. There's no substitute for real world testing to prove we're got this working right."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-06 17:05:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-06 16:39:24.000000000', 'message': "Ban database access in nova-compute

This adds a wedge between nova-compute and the database implementation
to specifically catch, log, and deny accesses. Theoretically, this
should not be needed as a production environment would not even have
the compute nodes configured to talk to the database. However, testing
and upgraded environments may retain database access and thus avoid
hitting real issues that can be fixed up prior to release. Putting
this into the tree now will help ensure we have a consistent error
scenario for test setups prior to release.

Note that if nova is configured to use a local conductor, we do not
insert the wedge, which provides an easy out for anyone needing to
get a production system past a missed database access.

Related to bp no-db-compute.

Based on Russell's original tracer hack:

   I328fa92d5bfdadd5022f5c7efe981396d8ae7962

Change-Id: I478230220633e0d2ff94b6a4d756e07eab8517d7

commit_message:
Ban database access in nova-compute

This adds a wedge between nova-compute and the database implementation
to specifically catch, log, and deny accesses. Theoretically, this
should not be needed as a production environment would not even have
the compute nodes configured to talk to the database. However, testing
and upgraded environments may retain database access and thus avoid
hitting real issues that can be fixed up prior to release. Putting
this into the tree now will help ensure we have a consistent error
scenario for test setups prior to release.

Note that if nova is configured to use a local conductor, we do not
insert the wedge, which provides an easy out for anyone needing to
get a production system past a missed database access.

Related to bp no-db-compute.

Based on Russell's original tracer hack:

   I328fa92d5bfdadd5022f5c7efe981396d8ae7962

Change-Id: I478230220633e0d2ff94b6a4d756e07eab8517d7

Add NVP Security group support

Implements blueprint security-groups-nvp

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1803, 'name': 'Michael J Fork', 'email': 'mjfork@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'mjfork'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4601, 'name': 'Tiago Mello', 'email': 'tmello@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'tmello'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 5371, 'name': 'Mathew Odden', 'email': 'locke105@gmail.com', 'username': 'locke105'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-01-15 15:11:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Okay, but this doesn't actually do what the commit message says, right? It seems to do two distinct things:

1. Add the generate_mac_address() method to the network manager, so that it can be overridden

2. Make some changes to the powervm driver to pass network_info down to the lower layers

The sum of this doesn't actually change the mac generation in such a way that makes the powervm driver able to do the right thing, does it? Maybe I'm missing something...

Regardless, I think that the two points above are probably best done as two separate patches, one for allowing the core method to be overridden and one for the differing behavior in the powervm driver."}, {'account_id': 5371, 'date': '2013-01-15 15:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I guess Dan has a good point about separating it into two changes. 

The portion where the virtual eth device string is built in operator.py is where the new MAC address is set.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-01-15 15:17:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, but IIRC, it requires a MAC that has been generated with the foresight that it will be used in that method in that way. Otherwise, there's no reason to break out the generate method in the network manager."}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2013-01-15 15:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2013-01-15 15:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Added the missing nova/network/powervm/manager.py that does the generation and adds the PowerVM network managers.'}, {'account_id': 5371, 'date': '2013-01-15 16:49:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good now that we have the PowerVM manager :)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-01-15 17:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Makes sense now :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-15 17:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/19707/2/check/gate-nova-docs/12393 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19707/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/17699 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19707/2/check/gate-nova-python26/13858 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19707/2/check/gate-nova-python27/13907 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19707/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/26792 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19707/2/check/gate-devstack-vm-quantum/3644 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/19707/2/check/gate-nova-pylint/6335 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-01-16 20:07:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Modifying your virt driver to use network_info is great, but you aren't actually using it. You've written code to ensure a special value is generated in the network manager, and then use only that value, neglecting the rest.

Instead, I would recommend using the existing structure but modifying the last three hex values of the mac address in your virt driver. Another solution would be to make utils.generate_mac_address() pluggable.

Virt specific code should not be in nova/network. Network topology and virt should be discrete parts of a deployment. There are also external managers to consider, as well as other networking projects. If compute can't expect all virt drivers to react similarly to sets of information/commands, we're doing it wrong. For example, imagine a nonhomogeneous Openstack deployment. How could this ever work?"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-01-16 20:31:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Looks like baremetal introduced a perfect solution to this, which allows the driver to influence the mac address to be used before the allocate_network() step.

Michael, I think you can change your patch to use this and avoid everything other than a quick addition to your driver :)"}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2013-01-16 21:11:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Trey here; Hypervisor specific code shouldn't be in the network manager. If you have implementation specific needs, make modifications in the relevant hypervisor driver."}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2013-01-23 04:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2013-01-23 04:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Refactored this change to use the new hypervisor-supplied-nics support, which isolated the PowerVM code to the PowerVM driver.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-23 05:19:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
hypervisor-supplied-nics support in PowerVM

PowerVM does not allow MAC addresses to be directly set on LPARs.
Instead, use the hypervisor-supplied-nics feature to generate MAC
addresses we can ensure are provisioned correctly.

blueprint powervm-compute-resize-migration

Change-Id: Idad7f03d9fd61970912ec1a6978fc0af56309df4

Use importutils.try_import() for MySQLdb

This is a common pattern we've adopted elsewhere, so use it here too.

Change-Id: I2e0947b4857005b478e796e9c9a7c05ea1f0d926

commit_message:
Remove pointless use of OpenStackException

The use of the base exception does nothing for the test but means
the "dead module walking" exception module.

Change-Id: Ibd7bb8aa526be366f005ab5e12fd4da89a976c57

commit_message:
Remove openstack.common.db.common

Since this only contains exceptions that are either used in session.py
or utils.py (not both), it seems sensible to move them into the modules
where they are used.

Also, remove the use of the Invalid base exception class since we don't
seem to be making use of the base class anywhere by catching it rather
than the more specialized exceptions.

Change-Id: Ib05bb2e0a9494e1dc60c60b8eee0e76b5d2ee555

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-04 23:12:34.000000000', 'message': 'Provide creating real unique constraints for columns

Main issue is that we can't create unique constraint for columns, because
we are using soft deletion of entries (set `deleted` column to True).

The main idea is to use `deleted` columns to create unique constraint for
columns. For example (`col1`, `deleted`).

To make (`col1`, `deleted`) unique after entry deletion, we should assign the
value of `id` to `deleted` column.

Change type of `deleted` column from Boolean to table.id.type for all tables.

Change models.soft_delete() method to assign table.id instead of True to
`deleted` column.

Change query.soft_delete() method to assign literal_column("id") instead of True

blueprint db-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ie1f67f49a5d085e6371efb63fc23a1c8b25d9464

commit_message:
Provide creating real unique constraints for columns

Main issue is that we can't create unique constraint for columns, because
we are using soft deletion of entries (set `deleted` column to True).

The main idea is to use `deleted` columns to create unique constraint for
columns. For example (`col1`, `deleted`).

To make (`col1`, `deleted`) unique after entry deletion, we should assign the
value of `id` to `deleted` column.

Change type of `deleted` column from Boolean to table.id.type for all tables.

Change models.soft_delete() method to assign table.id instead of True to
`deleted` column.

Change query.soft_delete() method to assign literal_column("id") instead of True

blueprint db-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ie1f67f49a5d085e6371efb63fc23a1c8b25d9464

commit_message:
Fix missing wrap_db_error for Session.execute() method

We should add wrap_db_error for Session.execute() method, because
Query.update() method will call Session.execute() and it is not inside
Session.flush(), so exceptions from Query.update() wouldn't be wrapped.

Add test for Session.flush() wrapper
Add test for Session.execute() wrapper

Fixes bug 1107890

Change-Id: I96894e502f9f279999b61a1e66469e34a07a022d

commit_message:
Fix eventlet/mysql db pooling code

Eventlet versions >= 0.10 return a tuple from
db_pool.ConnectionPool().create(), not a scalar.

Also, set the FOUND_ROWS client flag, which sqlalchemy
appears to require to sanity check the number of rows
touch.

bug 1097992

Change-Id: I64e798660c506fcd13947a232cb7832db0318360

commit_message:
Use oslo database code

Bring in the new database code from oslo.

Uses get_session() from oslo as well as changing NovaBase to derive from
a common class.

Remove test_sqlalchemy.py now that this code is test in oslo.

Implements blueprint db-common.

Change-Id: I090754981c871250dd981cbbe1a08e7181440120

commit_message:
Add support for directly stringifying VersionInfo.

glanceclient, and others, want to have a __version__ member in their
top-level __init__.py. This leads to attempting to process the
version information to realize the string at import time, rather
than at request time. If we make VersionInfo a thing which can
behave like a string, then, we should get the things we want without
the operational weirdness.

Change-Id: I3eb15006f50ed1155c85977aaae842677c5ec4bc

commit_message:
Apply doc conventions to service v. project names.

Based on http://wiki.openstack.org/Documentation/Conventions

Renames the book file and adjusts the pom.xml accordingly.

Removes "Nova" "Keystone" and "Quantum" and replaces with
OpenStack Compute, Identity, Networking names where appropriate.

Patchset removes erroneous OpenStack OpenStack in the overview.
Patchset addresses Dan's comments.

Change-Id: Iad05a0d6f6c499b628cb8d4821496b6a1036bb62

commit_message:
Fix inject_files for storing binary file.

Now a nova-api server decodes injected_files by base64 after receiving
encoded files from nova-client.
And the server fails to publish run_instance because utf8 codec can't
decode due to binary data.

This patch fixes this problem, because the base64 decode is operated when
a nova-compute server receives injected_files from a nova-api server.

Fixes bug 1112134

Change-Id: I664134c74893a970de4464161071692a5b2b5ce7
